Daniel Jacob is the Vasco McCoy Family Professor of Atmospheric Chemistry and Environmental Engineering at Harvard and works on interpretation of satellite observations of atmospheric composition.

## Education

- [PhD in Environmental Engineering]{.fw-bold} | Caltech | 1980 - 1985
- [Ingenieur Chimiste]{.fw-bold} | ESPCI Paris  | 1977-1980
